Both are great choices, but they differ greatly in tone and setting. Enjoy your movie time!

I'm delighted to see you're interested in such a diverse range of films! Given your preference for movies from 2004, set in various languages, and intriguing plots, I'd highly recommend "The Machinist". It's a thought-provoking film about an industrial worker who hasn't slept in a year, causing him to question his own sanity. Christian Bale delivers a powerful performance in this unique drama.

If you're looking for something with a bit of humor mixed in, "Connie and Carla" might be right up your alley! This comedy follows two singers who disguise themselves as drag queens to escape from the mob, leading to some unexpected romantic entanglements. Nia Vardalos (from My Big Fat Greek Wedding) stars in this fun and heartwarming film. Enjoy your movie-watching journey!

Given that you're interested in movies from 2004 and mentioned Mel Gibson as an actor, I'd highly recommend "We Were Soldiers". It's a powerful war drama directed by Mel Gibson himself, where he also stars alongside a talented ensemble cast. The movie tells the story of the first major battle of the American phase of the Vietnam War.

If you fancy something more humorous and less serious, you might enjoy "Monty Python and the Holy Grail". This classic comedy features some of the most beloved Monty Python members, including Eric Idle, Graham Chapman, John Cleese, Michael Palin, and Terry Gilliam. The plot follows King Arthur's quest for the Holy Grail in a surreal and silly adventure. Enjoy!
